org.openimaj.content.animation.animator

Interface ValueAnimator<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of value produced
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ReversableValueAnimator<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractValueAnimator, ByteArrayValueAnimator, DoubleArrayValueAnimator, FloatArrayValueAnimator, ForwardBackwardLoopingValueAnimator, IntegerArrayValueAnimator, LinearByteValueAnimator, LinearDoubleValueAnimator, LinearFloatValueAnimator, LinearIntegerValueAnimator, LinearLongValueAnimator, LinearShortValueAnimator, LinearTimeBasedByteValueAnimator, LinearTimeBasedDoubleValueAnimator, LinearTimeBasedFloatValueAnimator, LinearTimeBasedIntegerValueAnimator, LinearTimeBasedLongValueAnimator, LinearTimeBasedShortValueAnimator, LongArrayValueAnimator, LoopingValueAnimator, RandomLinearByteValueAnimator, RandomLinearDoubleValueAnimator, RandomLinearFloatValueAnimator, RandomLinearIntegerValueAnimator, RandomLinearLongValueAnimator, RandomLinearShortValueAnimator, ShortArrayValueAnimator, TimeBasedValueAnimator

    public interface ValueAnimator<T>
    Interface for objects capable of "animating" a value; that is providing a new value everytime nextValue() is called, subject to some constraints.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasFinished()
      Has the animator finished animating the value.
      T nextValue()
      Get the next value.
      void reset()
      Reset the animator back to its initial condition.

    • Method Detail

      • nextValue

        T nextValue()
        Get the next value. If the animator has finished, the continuation is checked to see if there are more animators to run. If not, then the last value is returned.
        Returns:
        the next value.

      • hasFinished

        boolean hasFinished()
        Has the animator finished animating the value.
        Returns:
        true if the animator has finished; false otherwise

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the animator back to its initial condition.
